author: lore01434
content:
Install Debank or use the web version, or you can simply take occasional screenshots of your USUALx balance ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.
It's a primitive method, but it works.
If you choose to use Etherscan, I'll leave the link for you in case you don't know it.
Go to this address, enter your wallet address in the search bar where it says "Search by Address", then scroll down and click on "Token Transfers (ERC-20)".
Voil√†, now you can see how many USUALx tokens you've received.
Good luck. ü§úüí•ü§õ

author: lore01434
content:
The #USUAL app has a new interface.
If someone says they haven't received their reward in USD0, they should open the app and tap the button shown in the image.
It seems that now you can also claim rewards smaller than 10 USD0, and we cover the gas fee ‚õΩ.
If you don't want to withdraw your funds yet, simply don't tap the button. The rewards will accumulate. 
Don't worry, if you leave them there, they won't be lost.
Peace, sex, and rock and roll ü§ò

if the collateral amount is constant then it should be:

content: Not sure I've understood. For 3 days, the daily USL reward is cumulated in the pending section. The fourth day it is moved from the pending reward section to the claimable rewards
